unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.foot_trajectory¶

unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.foot_trajectory.bezier(points, num_points=50)[source]¶

Generates a Bézier curve from a list of control points.

Parameters: points (list of tuples): List of control points (x, y). num_points (int): Number of points to generate along the curve.

Returns: list of tuples: Points on the Bézier curve.

unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.foot_trajectory.foot_trajectory(NUM_POINTS_BEZIER=50, NUM_POINTS_STANCE=50)[source]¶
unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.foot_trajectory.generate_control_points(standx, Lspan, deltaL, delta, standy, Yspan, deltaY)[source]¶

Generates control points for the Bézier curve based on given parameters.

Parameters: standx (float): Stand x-coordinate. Lspan (float): Span in the x-direction. deltaL (float): Change in the x-direction for some points. delta (float): Small delta for some y-coordinates. standy (float): Stand y-coordinate. Yspan (float): Span in the y-direction. deltaY (float): Change in the y-direction for some points.

Returns: list of tuples: Control points.

unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.foot_trajectory.generate_trajectory(standx, Lspan, deltaL, delta, standy, Yspan, deltaY, num_points_bezier=50, num_points_stance=50)[source]¶
unitree_legged_sdk.example_py.Bezier.foot_trajectory.stance_phase(start_point, end_point, num_points=50, delta=0.007)[source]¶

Generates a stance-phase trajectory using a sinusoidal function.

Parameters: start_point (tuple): The starting point of the stance phase. end_point (tuple): The ending point of the stance phase. num_points (int): Number of points to generate along the stance trajectory. amplitude (float): Amplitude of the sinusoidal function.

Returns: list of tuples: Points on the stance-phase trajectory.
